snippet: The successful prosecution of a man accused of selling more than $9 million of fake fuel credits highlighted one of several schemes connected to the federal biofuel program.
abstract: Prosecution of Rodney R Hailey, man accused of selling more than $9 million in fake fuel credits, highlights one of several schemes connected to a federal biofuel program designed to reduce dependence on foreign oil; frauds have sown distrust of all biodiesel producers, virtually freezing the market for credits, and putting many small producers in danger of shutting down.
lead_paragraph: The successful prosecution of a man accused of selling more than $9 million of fake fuel credits highlighted one of several schemes connected to the federal biofuel program.

headline.seo: Biofuel Fraud Case Shows Weak Spots in Energy Credit Program
headline.main: Fraud Case Shows Holes in Exchange of Fuel Credits
headline.print_headline: Fraud Case Shows Holes in Energy Credit Exchanges
